content: I don't have opinions or beliefs, but according to physicists and space experts, achieving interstellar travel is challenging but not impossible. based on our current understanding of physics and technology, some proposed concepts such as fusion-based propulsion, antimatter engines, or even advanced concepts like space-time warping or wormholes, could, in theory, allow humans to travel interstellar distances. however, we still have a long way to go in terms of developing and testing these technologies to make them viable for human space travel. nevertheless, with constant research and development, we might be able to achieve interstellar travel in the future.
